newsitem.title: USA: BP says Ohio refinery fire slows crude unit.
newsitem.headline: BP says Ohio refinery fire slows crude unit.

text.p: British Petroleum said a fire on Saturday at its 155,000 barrels per day (bpd) Toledo, Ohio refinery has forced throughput reductions in the crude unit.
BP would not specify the exact run cuts, the estimated duration of the reductions or what parts of the refinery crude units were impacted by the incident.
Industry sources, however, said the crude and vacuum distillation units were down, with vacuum distillation unit out of service until late November.
A BP spokesperson said there was no cause for the fire, as an "assessment" was continuing.
The fire started at 1900 EDT (2300 GMT) Saturday and was extinguished two hours later, though a smaller fire was not put out until 0500 EDT (0900 GMT) Sunday morning, the spokeswoman said.
